decision_conditions: The proposed extension, by reason of its overall size, scale, bulk, height, width and depth, would result in an excessive, bulky, dominant, overbearing and visually intrusive form of development that would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original semi-detached dwelling, would be detrimental to the character, appearance and symmetry of the pair of semi-detached houses of which it forms a part and to the visual amenities of the street scene and the surrounding area. Therefore the proposal would be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020).

The proposed extension, by reason of its siting, size, scale, bulk, height and proximity, would be detrimental to the amenities of the adjoining occupiers at 61 Ladygate Lane, by reason of overdominance, visual intrusion, overbearing impact, loss of daylight/sunlight and loss of outlook. As such, the proposal would be contrary to Policies DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).
description: Part single storey, part two storey side/rear extension and conversion of integral garage into habitable space involving replacement of garage door with window following demolition of existing rear conservatory, detached garage and shed
